snippet: The attacks took place in two villages in the northeastern Indian state of Assam, where tensions have pitted members of the Bodo tribal group against non-Bodo residents.
abstract: Eleven people are killed in two separate attacks on western villages in Assam, India, where long-simmering tensions have pitted members of Bodo tribal group against non-Bodo residents.

byline.original: By NIDA NAJAR and HARI KUMAR

lead_paragraph: The attacks took place in two villages in the northeastern Indian state of Assam, where tensions have pitted members of the Bodo tribal group against non-Bodo residents.

headline.main: Militants Kill 11 in Northeastern India, Police Say
